a.span: TAX SAVINGS FOR SENIOR CITIZENS & HOMEOWNERS
NYSED COMMON CORE RESOURCES FOR PARENTS AND FAMILIES
CHILD CARE FOR FIRST RESPONDERS & MEDICAL PROVIDERS

div.p: In light of the Governorâ€™s announcement, Tuckahoe Schools will now be closed through May 15, 2020, although this could be extended. This includes all before, during and after school activities.

Please note the turf field at Tuckahoe High School should not be accessed by the public unless there is a school sponsored event or a gathering approved to use the field by the District pursuant to Board policy.Â At the current time, turf use is prohibited and access is locked.Â We ask that you speak to your children about accessing the turf, even if it is unlocked, and not to climb the fence.

p.a: eLearning and Who to Contact Information

div.p: Free Internet Access for Students Due to CoronavirusÂ

Please note that all students on the free/reduced meal program or students in need of food due to the school closure will be able to pick up a bagged breakfast and lunch from ECAP at 142 Main Street, Tuckahoe between the hours of 8am-10am, on weekdays.

div.aria-label: Message: Parents/Guardians Who are First Responders and Health Care Workers

h2.span: Message: Parents/Guardians Who are First Responders and Health Care Workers

div.p:
Due to the Westchester County and New York State of Emergency, the Tuckahoe Union Free School District is responding to childcare needs for the children of essential health care workers and first responders who live in the Tuckahoe School District community.Â
Essential health care workers include licensed health professionals such as physicians, nurse practitioners, physician assistants, registered nurses, LPNs, nurse assistants or laboratory personnel. First responders include paramedics, emergency medical technicians, firefighters. police officers, and other public safety personnel.
The Tuckahoe Union Free School District is partnering with the YMCA of Central and Northern Westchester in White Plains to provide this childcare, available for children ages 5 through 12 at no charge to families, each weekday between the hours of 7:30am to 6:30pm.
If you are a Tuckahoe parent/guardian of a child ages 5 through 12 and you are an essential health care worker or first responderÂ and need childcare, please complete this survey and follow the link at the end to also register with the YMCA:Â https://forms.gle/TXeo2859NwqEKvK97
